title: Help Find Jim Gray
body: <p><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/JimGray/Samples:TenaciousHiRez/sample1.bmp" alt="boat 1" /><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/JimGray/Samples:TenaciousHiRez/sample2.bmp" alt="boat 2" /><img src="http://s3.amazonaws.com/JimGray/Samples:TenaciousHiRez/sample3.bmp" alt="boat 3" /></p><p>You can help look for <a href="http://news.google.com/news?q=jim+gray">Jim Gray</a> using <a href="http://www.mturk.com/mturk/preview?groupId=J0XZ58STDWJZ5QY4F9M0">Amazon's Mechanical Turk</a>. It's kinda boring but it just might save his life, so that's kinda cool. It's somewhat like SETI@Home, except that it's up to you to analyze the images, and you probably have a better chance of finding something.</p>
